episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and historical facts, including the unusual physical characteristics of the author George Eliot, the culinary habits of cricketers at Lord's, the unique upside-down lighthouse in Northern Ireland, and a dangerous arm wrestling arcade machine in Japan.

facts.fact: The author, George Elliott, had a massive head.
The chef who cooked for Lord's Cricketers on match days for 35 years was once asked to limit their meals to five courses, and she refused.
Northern Ireland contains the world's only upside-down lighthouse.
In 2007, a Japanese arm wrestling arcade machine was recalled when it broke three players' arms.
